313.body: Don't take forever to make a decision, but don't make it too fast.
313.author: Micah Baldwin

314.body: If you don't have people that care about usability on your project, your project is doomed.
314.author: Jeff Atwood

315.body: The lean startup method is not about cost, it is about speed.
315.author: Eric Ries

316.body: Whether you think you can, or you think you can't - you're right.
316.author: Henry Ford

318.body: When bootstrapping, you need to find a team that's willing to work for nothing and spend their off hours with you.
318.author: Spencer Fry

319.body: Expect and hope that a quarter of your projects fail. If not, you're not taking enough risks.
319.author: Adam Smith

320.body: The difference between a vision and a hallucination is that other people can see the vision.
320.author: Marc Andreessen

321.body: We're not really good at knowing what we want, and we are very quick to say "this sucks". That's where the opportunity lies.
321.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

322.body: There are lots of good reasons to abandon a project. Having a little competition is not one of them.
322.author: Seth Godin

323.body: We are really competing against ourselves, we have no control over how other people perform.
323.author: Pete Cashmore

324.body: The key to success for everything in business, science and technology is never to follow the others.
324.author: Masaru Ibuka

325.body: We never thought of it as customer service. We just treat people how we want to be treated.
325.author: Sally Strebel

326.body: Pick out associates whose behavior is better than yours and you'll drift in that direction.
326.author: Warren Buffet

327.body: Starting a company is like getting married and having a kid.
327.author: Matt Brezina

328.body: Sweat equity is the best startup capital.
328.author: Mark Cuban

329.body: In deciding whether to include a service, look at how it fits in with the overall vision.
329.author: Iain Dodsworth

330.body: If you believe in something, work nights and weekends, it won't feel like work.
330.author: Kevin Rose

331.body: Don't make decisions based on fear.
331.author: Jake Nickell

332.body: Be a user of your own product. Make it better based on your own desires. But don't trick yourself into thinking you are your user.
332.author: Evan Williams

333.body: Features are like having sex. You make one mistake and you have to support it for life.
333.author: Dave McClure

334.body: Don't throw out buzz words without really knowing what is going on behind it.
334.author: Salman Khan

335.body: Your reputation is more important than your paycheck, and your integrity is worth more than your career.
335.author: Ryan Freitas

336.body: When you're ready to quit, you're closer than you think.
336.author: Bob Parsons

337.body: Branding is what you do, not what you call it.
337.author: Jason Cohen

338.body: Stay self-funded as long as possible.
338.author: Garrett Camp

339.body: Success breeds complacency. Complacency breeds failure. Only the paranoid survive.
339.author: Andrew Grove

340.body: Every time we launch a feature, people yell at us.
340.author: Angelo Sotira

341.body: Forget about your competitors, just focus on your customers.
341.author: Jack Ma

342.body: I like to pride myself on thinking pretty long term, but not that long term.
342.author: Mark Zuckerberg

343.body: To us it's not just about money, it's about enjoying what we do and believing in it.
343.author: Paul Farnell

344.body: Make your product easier to buy than your competition, or you will find your customers buying from them, not you.
344.author: Mark Cuban

345.body: Working on the right thing is probably more important than working hard.
345.author: Caterina Fake

346.body: We live in a world where you're not being eaten by a lion when you fail, you just have to get another job.
346.author: Michael Arrington

347.body: If you need scale in order to create value, it's hard to get scale, because there's little incentive for the first people to use the product.
347.author: Joshua Schachter

348.body: Among idealists and visionaries, there is no shortage of good intent, but there's often a shortage of discipline.
348.author: Scott Belsky

349.body: Don't compromise what you wouldn't want for a quick buck.
349.author: Noah Everett

350.body: Observe the world around you - everything you do, and especially everything you  hate to do.
350.author: Aaron Patzer

351.body: If you want to succeed, you've got to be okay to just lose control.
351.author: Alexis Ohanian

352.body: Do what you're passionate about, I'm working hard at something I truly love.
352.author: Sam Lessin

353.body: You need to keep your head down and build a great product before you raise money.
353.author: Dina Kaplan

354.body: Be undeniably good. No marketing effort or social media buzzword can be a substitute for that.
354.author: Anthony Volodkin

355.body: Human nature has a tendency to admire complexity but reward simplicity.
355.author: Ben Huh

356.body: Money is like gasoline during a road trip. You don't want to run out of gas on your trip, but you're not doing a tour of gas stations.
356.author: Tim O'Reilly

357.body: Most users have no imagination. They want what they know. When they say they want the future, what they are really saying is that they want a moderately updated version of the past.
357.author: MG Siegler

358.body: I try to keep the meetings small, especially when we're doing product design.
358.author: Justin Kan

359.body: Having a partner definitely allows you to take more risks.
359.author: Arianna Huffington

360.body: If your business is static, you're likely to have issues.
360.author: Larry Page

361.body: The last 10% it takes to launch something takes as much energy as the first 90%.
361.author: Rob Kalin

362.body: While you're figuring out what to do, we've tried two different things and have figured out the right one.
362.author: Josh James

363.body: Planning is valuable, tho the plan is usually useless.
363.author: Ben Horowitz

364.body: Every day at a startup is a roller coaster.
364.author: Mike Hudack

365.body: It's hard to do a really good job on anything you don't think about in the shower.
365.author: Paul Graham

366.body: Criticism is the best sign you're onto something.
366.author: Rands

367.body: We don't make movies to make money, we make money to make more movies.
367.author: Walt Disney

368.body: If you are not embarrassed by the first version of your product, you've launched too late.
368.author: Reid Hoffman

369.body: Successful bootstrapping is all about discipline and stamina.
369.author: Kevin Hale

370.body: Whatever future you're building, don't try to program everything.
370.author: Pierre Omidyar

371.body: Discs and memory are far cheaper than annoying your customers.
371.author: Steve Huffman

372.body: When you have rich exchange of ideas, stuff happens.
372.author: Andrew Lacy

373.body: Set measurable goals, measure relative to competition.
373.author: Joe Kraus

374.body: If a user is having a problem, it's our problem.
374.author: Steve Jobs

376.body: Being a founder is like being a parent. You always stay involved.
376.author: Bart Decrem

377.body: If everyone is trying to prevent error, it screws things up.
377.author: Edwin Catmull

378.body: People capable of making enough money to never work again are the same people who will never quit working.
378.author: Chris Dixon

379.body: We've tried to keep as cheap and lean an operation as possible.
379.author: David Karp

380.body: In a startup, absolutely nothing happens unless you make it happen.
380.author: Marc Andreessen

381.body: Projections are bullshit. They're just guesses.
381.author: Jason Fried

382.body: If someone asks you for something, provide them with a clear "No" or a delivery date.
382.author: Omar Hamoui

383.body: The startups that do well are the ones that are working all the time.
383.author: Sam Altman

384.body: We are our choices. Build yourself a great story.
384.author: Jeff Bezos

385.body: The only way to train for a startup is by starting.
385.author: Chris Campbell

386.body: We never try to sell to the dumb consumer. We always try to sell to the smart consumer.
386.author: Matt Rutledge

387.body: Ultimately the presence of other well known players is driving us to build a more compelling, innovative product.
387.author: Josh Williams

389.body: Take the initiative to ask your customers what they think than to wait for your competitors to do it.
389.author: John Wechsler

390.body: It takes some experimentation to figure out what people like and don't like.
390.author: Andrew Mason

391.body: To be successful, you have to have quantity of quality.
391.author: Mark Frauenfelder

392.body: Making a product better often requires removing features.
392.author: Marco Arment

393.body: If I had asked my customers what they wanted, they would have said a faster horse.
393.author: Henry Ford

394.body: Waiting for perfect is never as smart as making progress.
394.author: Seth Godin

395.body: It's not about what you're saying, it's about how you listen.
395.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

396.body: History has shown that it's hard for clones to get significant traction.
396.author: Ade Olonoh

397.body: If you can't feed a team with two pizzas, it's too large.
397.author: Jeff Bezos

398.body: Scatter-gun approach rarely works, as you're only splitting your ideas and energy.
398.author: Adii Pienaar

400.body: It all starts with a great idea and teamwork.
400.author: Garrett Camp

401.body: Not having a clear goal leads to death by a thousand compromises.
401.author: Mark Pincus

402.body: Grow a thick skin and be prepared to take criticism.
402.author: Mark Forrester

403.body: Be amazing, be everywhere, be real.
403.author: Jason Calacanis

404.body: We won't risk the integrity of our brand by putting a can of soda in the foreground.
404.author: Gregg Spiridellis

405.body: Do the stuff you enjoy, as opposed to the stuff you think you should be doing.
405.author: Evan Spiridellis

406.body: The biggest problem for entrepreneurs when they start a company is that they tend to listen too much to friends.
406.author: Peter Shankman

407.body: It's in everyone's nature to say "You can't do this". The world will see.
407.author: Sam Tarantino

408.body: Don't spend so much time trying to choose the perfect opportunity, that you miss the right opportunity.
408.author: Michael Dell

409.body: You have to specialize the product.
409.author: Lars Hinrichs

410.body: Always look for the fool in the deal. If you don't find one, it's you.
410.author: Mark Cuban

411.body: Listening is not a displacement for leadership. You have to have leadership.
411.author: Angelo Sotira

412.body: We are the market, we know what we want.
412.author: Josh Greenberg

413.body: A business model that hasn't been tried before is always interesting, even if it's likely to fail.
413.author: Michael Arrington

414.body: If everybody has a voice, then you end up with something average.
414.author: Jason Calacanis

415.body: If you have a strong, loyal community, you can do anything.
415.author: Jacob Dehart

416.body: All MBA have said are correct, but they can't execute it.
416.author: Jack Ma

417.body: Patience, drive and very little fear.
417.author: Jake Nickell

418.body: Keep an idea log where you write everything down, even the bad ideas.
418.author: Joshua Schachter

419.body: I don't look to jump over 7-foot bars: I look around for 1-foot bars that I can step over.
419.author: Warren Buffet

420.body: It's okay to doubt yourself, it's okay to feel down; just never give up.
420.author: Aaron Patzer

421.body: You need to build up your readership before you start selling ads.
421.author: Todd Garland

422.body: We're not motivated by money. We are into this thing that we're building.
422.author: David Karp

423.body: You have to be ready for hard work and frugal spending to get the idea off the ground.
423.author: Garrett Camp

424.body: We don't have meetings unless absolutely necessary.
424.author: Caterina Fake

425.body: Don't try to solve the entire problem on day one.
425.author: Fred Wilson

426.body: I find it best to dive right in and learn the hard way.
426.author: Pete Cashmore

427.body: If everyone loves everything that we're releasing all the time, we are failing.
427.author: Jen Bekman

429.body: It's not about ideas. It's about making ideas happen.
429.author: Scott Belsky

430.body: Have lots of experiments, but make sure they're strategically focused.
430.author: Adam Smith

432.body: You cannot be afraid to fail, so do not wait too long to pull the trigger with a product launch.
432.author: Matt Brezina

433.body: Do you create anything, or just criticize others work and belittle their motivations?
433.author: Steve Jobs

434.body: There is nothing wrong with staying small. You can do big things with a small team.
434.author: Jason Fried

435.body: Don't worry about failure; you only have to be right once.
435.author: Drew Houston

436.body: A good idea is worthless without impeccable execution and a commitment to iterate.
436.author: Zach Klein

437.body: Get five or six of your smartest friends in a room and ask them to rate your idea.
437.author: Mark Pincus

438.body: You can't put out projects that you don't use yourself.
438.author: Gary Vaynerchuk

439.body: Don't worry about people stealing your design work. Worry about the day they stop.
439.author: Jeffrey Zeldman

440.body: I love well-designed products that combine form and functionality.
440.author: Kevin Rose

441.body: Price is what you pay. Value is what you get.
441.author: Warren Buffet

442.body: You don't need to win every medal to be successful.
442.author: Jason Fried

443.body: Constraints inspire us in how we approach the press, how we approach business relationships, how we do everything.
443.author: Jack Dorsey

444.body: Investors are employees you can never hire. We made sure to pick investors that thought like us.
444.author: Biz Stone

445.body: It's a gold rush ad we're selling the shovels.
445.author: Josh Williams

448.body: Fail often so you can succeed sooner.
448.author: Tom Kelley

449.body: A product needs to be sufficiently innovative to distinguish itself from the pack, but not so forward thinking as to alienate the user.
449.author: Reid Hoffman

450.body: Dedication to quality, community, and originality - without exception.
450.author: Zach Klein

451.body: Chase the vision, not the money, the money will end up following you.
451.author: Tony Hsieh

452.body: I mostly built stuff that I liked.
452.author: Mark Zuckerberg

454.body: A business has to be involving, it has to be fun, and it has to exercise your creative instincts.
454.author: Richard Branson

455.body: We are currently not planning on conquering the world.
455.author: Sergey Brin

456.body: Get big quietly, so you don't tip off potential competitors.
456.author: Chris Dixon

457.body: We watch our competitors, learn from them, see the things that they were doing for customers and copy those things as much as we can.
457.author: Jeff Bezos

458.body: Don't try to be original, just try to be good.
458.author: Paul Rand

459.body: You don't need to have a 100-person company to develop that idea.
459.author: Larry Page

460.body: For the most ambitious young people, the corporate ladder is obsolete.
460.author: Paul Graham

461.body: We have a 'strategic' plan. It's called doing things.
461.author: Herb Kelleher

462.body: Why join the navy if you can be a pirate?
462.author: Steve Jobs

463.body: Your most unhappy customers are your greatest source of learning.
463.author: Bill Gates

464.body: Ideas are easy. Implementation is hard.
464.author: Guy Kawasaki

465.body: It's not how much money we make that ultimately makes us happy between 9 and 5. It's whether our work fulfills us.
465.author: Malcolm Gladwell

466.body: The only thing worse than starting something and failing... is not starting something.
466.author: Seth Godin

467.body: Airbnb was never meant to be the big idea. It was meant to be the thing to pay the rent so we could think of the big idea. Along the way, by solving our problem it became the big idea.
467.author: Brian Chesky

468.body: To see the world, things dangerous to come to, to see behind walls, draw closer, to find each other and to feel. That is the purpose of life.
468.author: Walter Mitty
